ygData.subject: RE: PoA bard quests plus a rant
ygData.msgSnippet: You are taking longer to answer posts. getting cranky in your old age, and antisocial?;) -Martyn ... From: Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)
ygData.messageBody:
You are taking longer to answer posts. getting cranky in your old age, and
antisocial?;)
-Martyn

-----Original Message-----
From: Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)
[mailto:Michael.Garramone@...]
Sent: Sunday, January 30, 2000 12:54 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] PoA bard quests plus a rant


From: "Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)" <Michael.Garramone@...>

this thread was so long it took me a week almost to start reading it. i
knew this would come up if dragons were mentioned ;)

we killed vox right after the most recent patch, and i will say my
experience is more like Rokenn than it is like Harm. i died all the time in
my early dragon raids, but since going with resists i have yet to die, and
usually everyone in my group lives as well. i can end up taking almost no
damage from the breath spell, or i can take a bubb. i can have 1 bubb left
at the end of the fight or i can have 4 bubbs. anyway the last time i
specifically thought of you, because after getting hit by the first breath
spell i specifically looked at my health, which like Rokenn moved only 1/8th
bubb or so. and i am within melee range as i have DMF and basically ride on
her back so i get all my group in song range. anyway, late post just
passing the info along.

Shada Bladestorm, L50 Wood Elf Bard
Tyria Sarkin, L37 High Elf Wizard
<Afterlife> Mithaniel Marr Server


> From: Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...>
>
> > breath as over the weekend we did both Nag & Vox (other
> guilds were sloted
> > to do them but they could not take em and yield them to my
> guild). And in
> > both runs I has taking as little as 1/8th a bubble from
> dragon breaths. My
> > FR/CR was 220+ in both cases.
>
> I wasn't there, I can't say. And I can't call you a liar.
> But it's my opinion that you are exaggerating quite a bit.
>
> I've been next to a dragon three times, CR 222, FR 170 and
> I took 400, yes four-hundred, points of dmg regardless.
>
> And 1/8th of a bubble? Rokken, come on man gimme a break.
> You cannot expect me to believe that. heh. Your fish is getting
> a little too big.
>
> Harmonic.
